titleStmt.title: A Program for An Exposition entitled "The Negroes' Making in America".
titleStmt.author: Bethune-Cookman College

respStmt.name: Dr. Jametoria Burton and Janaya Ferrer

publicationStmt.p: This document forms part of the project "Editing the Earth M.M. White Collection" at the University of North Florida.

msIdentifier.repository: University of North Florida, Thomas G. Carpenter Library Special Collections and Archives

msContents.summary: A program for an exposition entitled "The Negroes' Making in America" under the auspices of the Choir of Laura Street Presbyterian Church and sponsored by Bethune-Cookman College.

objectDesc.p: A program typewritten on a single sheet of paper.

editorialDecl.p: This file was transcribed and encoded according to the editorial criteria of the project "Editing the Eartha M.M. White Collection." Using the various options encoded within <choice> elements, this file enables the viewing of a diplomatic transcription and a regularized reading text.

hi.name: The Choir Of Laura Street Presbyterian Church

div.p:
1. Hymn—“Lift Every Voice And Sing”............Congregation
2. Invocation .......................................Dr. E. J. Gregg, Pastor
3. Foreword.................................Attorney Geo. G. DeVaughn
4. (a) “Jesus Lover of My Soul” (Arranged) )
(b) “Come Out The Wilderness,” (A Jubilee)
Bethune-Cookman Glee Club
5. (a) “Go Mary and Toll De Bell” )
(b) “Sit Down! Lord, I Can’t Sit Down” )
Bethune-Cookman Quartette.
6. Chorale Spiritual, “The Four and Twenty Elders—Sykes
—Bethune-Cookman Glee Club and Chanson Circle.
7. Address—“Contributions Toward The Progress Of The
American Negroes Through) Education and Bethune-Cookman College”—Mrs. Mary McLeod Bethune, President
Bethune-Cookman College.
8. “Lindy Lou” (Arranged)..........Bethune-Cookman Female
Quartette.
9. Cornet Solo, “The Rosary”—Ethelbert Nevin—Rosary”—Mr. Kirby
Minott, Bethune-Cookman College.
10. “Crossing The Bar”—(Musical Setting)—Sykes—Bethune-Cookman Glee Club (Soprano Obligato, Mrs. Olivia
Adams.)
11. Remarks...........................Dr. E. J. Gregg
12. Offering.
13. Hymn.
Benediction.

Note:—The next Programprogram will be sponsored by Florida
Agricultural & Mechanical College, Sunday Eveningevening, October
26th.
Dean R. O’Hara Lanier will deliver the address.

Committee: Mrs. F. M. Morton, Mrs. Gussie Randall Williams
and Mrs. Mamie Mays Smith.
Attorney, Geo. G. DeVaughn, Director of Exposition.
